data.title: So so
data.text: An interesting concept but the cashew ice cream doesn't have the texture or flavor of the real thing.  Pretty expensive also for a pint ($12 !)

data.title: A+ for creativity
data.text: I love that the owner figured out how to make ice cream from cashews. Her shop is sweet and there are plenty of flavors to pick from. I think I'm a little too addicted to dairy ice cream so the consistency didn't do it for me. But its a great option for vegans and other adventurous souls.

data.title: I have fooled everyone I know into eating vegan ice cream!
data.text: What a cute little ice cream parlor! With a huge secret: they make best vegan ice cream on earth. The mint chip is truly the best mint chip ice cream, dairy-base or otherwise, I have ever had.

data.title: Perfect way to celebrate National Ice Cream Day!
data.text: Great selection of sweet treats and very helpful and kind employees. Definitely try the Banana Chocolate. Seriously the best dairy free ice cream I've ever had!

data.title: Who Knew?
data.text:
Who knew that ice cream could be made with cashews.. I sure didn't!  The dairy free ice cream at Cashew Cow is extraordinary! Especially the strawberry - tastes like you are eating the actual fruit. The chocolate doesn't have the creamy texture that I love so much but was very good nonetheless. The prices were what you would expect to pay at an ice cream specialty store. Extremely clean! I only gave it 4 stars because the chocolate wasn't up to my particular standard.  I would go back in a heartbeat!

Cashew Cow is Vegan friendly.

data.title: The absolute BEST non-dairy SUBSTITUTE for Ice Cream!
data.text:
Personable wait staff--very eager to please! When I asked if they would have "Kahlua Almond Fudge" TOMORROW, they said that they weren't absolutely certain BUT that they'd be happy to "pack it" for me and hold it for me in their freezer (which they did)!
The extra "special touch" is that they pack little ice-packs around your bagged purchase so that the product won't melt on the trip home.
I've introduced several friends and family members to this place and they've ALL been VERY impressed....
Their flavors are diverse, but they still have the "favorites" like standard chocolate and strawberry; their vanilla has a toasted-cinnamon added that's splendid. Not all flavors are available every day, of course, and the Kahlua Almond Fudge is their "most popular" flavor.
This place is a true TREASURE!!!

data.title: Lactose free, gluten free. .......
data.text: Found this little place. Amazing. I used to think that another local old Tucson place was the best. Not anymore. Cashew Cow is money.

data.title: Terrific flavors, creamy texture
data.text: After seeing an ad in Edible Baja magazine for this shop, I had to try it.  Being lactose intolerant, I miss ice cream! I don't care for cashews, so I was a bit reluctant but to my surprise and delight, this ice cream was delicious.  I ordered a small size with two flavors, mint and chocolate. I liked the fact that you can get two flavors in the small size.  The mint was out of this world.  Very minty and flavorful.  The chocolate was good but the mint was my favorite. Yes, it's a bit spendy but totally worth it.  While eating my ice cream, I had a nice chat with the owner of the shop. Her background is in nutrition and she wanted to create an ice cream that is good for you.  I think she has accomplished that! Parking is easy...either on the street in front of the shop or in a large adjacent parking lot. It's on a side street at Broadway Village, so you do have to  search for it but it is worth the search!  Also, they've recently opened a Natural Grocer at Broadway Village, so after eating your healthy ice cream, you can stock up on healthy foods. Win-win.

data.title: The best dairy free ice cream in Tucson!
data.text: What a wonderful find.  Our family is allergic to dairy and gluten (note they do have a couple a couple of choices that do include gluten so be sure to ask).  Great texture and creaminess....you won't miss the milk/cream.

data.title: A new way to enjoy ice cream without milk
data.text:
Found this at an ice cream fair at Maynards in downtown Tucson.  They are off Broadway.  You will need to hunt down the block to find the store...kinda hidden.  But worth the hunt!

Great flavors and much safer for your digestion than standard ice cream  

The product is more expensive than "standard" but you aren't eating "standard".

data.title: Lactose Intolerant? Love ice cream? Go to this place!
data.text: I'm lactose intolerant and the only thing I really miss is delicious ice cream. Those days are now gone. Went to this place on the recommendation of a friend and I was very pleasantly surprised. They had a lot of different flavors, which was nice. I had the raspberry vanilla swirl and mango. Absolutely great! They also had things like Pumpkin Pie Latte. The service was very nice and friendly, there was a cool vibe inside and she filled our pints up to the top. It was a special treat for the whole family. Only thing to have in mind is that it is a bit pricier than your average ice cream, but I felt like it was well worth it.

data.title: Modern decor, friendly staff, yummy dessert!
data.text: Stopped into the Cashew Cow to see if their product - non-dairy, nut based ice cream could be as good as a premium ice cream or Gelato. Yes, it can! The friendly staff were great at answering all my questions about calories, carbs and what to expect and offered samples so I could make an informed decision. We have been back twice and could become regulars. The chocolate is very rich - not unlike what you would expect if you used Nutella as a base for ice cream. Other flavors, including a very nice strawberry were all very good. A little pricey, but worth trying. Especially if you are vegan - but you don't have to be - the ice cream is really good!

data.title: Awesome scoops!
data.text: Noah at Zeemans Ethiopian restaurant recommend this and we're so glad he did.  Our first times to try a cashew 'ice cream'. Not a huge variety , 5 or 6 to choose from, but awesome scoops of frozen yumminess. Smooth and amazingly velvety creamy all the way to the last bite. Parking outside the door or across the street.

data.title: Yummy!
data.text: The four of us came in on a hot summer day. Each chose a different flavor. We tasted and shared. Each flavor as good or better than the one before. We will definitely be back!

data.title: Holy "cow!"
data.text:
After some friends of our recommended we came here during a sweltering day in Tucson. We are vegans so have tried many dairy free ice creams and this blew us away. It is soo creamy and the texture is so smooth I guarantee anyone would be fooled that this was "real" ice cream. Try the Kahlua almond, it's to die for!
The prices are a little on the expensive side, $6.50 for 2+ scoops, but if you've tried any other ice cream lately it is just expensive wherever you go, to include junk like Dairy Queen. Heck people spend that much almost every day on a coffee drink at Starbucks! Treat yourself, it's worth it!

data.title: Wowie Zowie!
data.text: We "herd" about this dairy-less ice cream shop from a fellow vegan. Having forgone dairy for years, I was anxious to see if this cashew-based treat met my dairy dreams.  I sampled the kahlua almond fudge and the coconut. Both were creamy and delicious! My omnivore husband had the kahlua and a scoop of strawberry.  The strawberry was loaded with fresh flavor, the coconut knocked my socks off, and the kahlua was incomparable. The scoops were generous; I got a double and ate the whole thing, but a single would've been plenty. Prices comparable to a fancy-schmancy ice creamery. I asked my husand if it was as good as ice cream, and he said "No, it's better." Can you beat that for an endorsement?! Definitely check these guys out. I will be back on my next trip to Tucson.

data.title: Just did not hit the mark
data.text: This is the second time to try this dessert shop for us. Again, left with disappointment. Tried two different flavors and both still gave a after texture feel left on our tongues. It was like the gritty nutty stuff from the cashews. Flavors was alright however, the price point was way to damaging to want to return. Service was below par for a place charging $10 for 2 small scoops. We will not return!!!

data.title: Vegan and Lactose-Intolerant Heaven!
data.text: This charming little cashew-based ice cream parlor is  spotlessly clean and has awesome frozen cashew cream!  This was the first time in way too long that my daughter and I enjoyed a creamy frozen treat with getting ill afterwards!   I had the lemon flavor, and my daughter enjoyed a half-scoop each of the dark chocolate and the raspberry swirl.  Highly recommended.   :-)

data.title: Great for vegans and everyone else
data.text: Really flavorful nondairy ice cream made from cashews. There were many (12?) flavors available each time I went. The two I tried were pistachio and coconut mixed with maple walnut. Unique, nutritious and delicious. Not overly sweet, but definitely rich and satisfying.

data.title: Quick healthy dessert
data.text: I was told this "ice cream" is made from cashews. To my surprise, I found it very good and tasteful. The store is very clean and the staff was super nice and friendly. Here in Tucson, its a great place to stop by to chill while out in the day. I tried the strawberry and loved it. Cant wait to go back to try the other flavors.
